page.title: 01THE AREA OF CHALFORD
page.content: Chalford is in the Cotswolds,not far from the town of Stroud.The area is on two hillsides.Through the valley between runs the River Frome,the main London Road,the remains of the Thames and Severn Canal and the London to Cheltenham Rail line.It is a beautiful area,the valley leading to Stroud is known as the Golden Valley.Ancient Cotswold stone houses cling to the steep hillsides.The area consists of four villages Oakridge, Bussage, Chalford and France Lynch; separated by woodland and farmland.It is a rural area with very little industry,apart from a few factories on an industrial estate beside the old canal.Most people travel outside the area to work.Chalford is a quiet and beautiful place to live in during the 1980's.
